entry.title: 509: The Next Gen Desktop
entry.summary: The first new desktop environment in a while that has caught our attention, and it promises to unlock the full power of cutting-edge Linux. Why we think every desktop will copy ideas from Hyprland soon.

entry.title: Linux Action News 291
entry.summary: The results from the recent HDR Hackfest, Mozilla's new acquisition, and the concerning crack down on free software encryption.

entry.title: 516: There is No Moat
entry.summary: Why open source might be the real AI winner long-term, and Mike gets the ultimate "I told you so."

entry.title: 508: The Worst Distro Ever
entry.summary: Two listeners race to set up a web server on Suicide Linux. One slip-up and it's all gone. Who will survive?

entry.title: Linux Action News 290
entry.summary: What we know about the Red Hat layoffs, highlights of Linux 6.3, and Canonical's bold claim in Ubuntu 23.04.

entry.title: 515: Codeium Comes for Copilot
entry.summary: We have a laugh at Elon's alt account, why the knives are out for GitHub Co-pilot, and our thoughts on Apple's "major victory" this week.

entry.title: 507: Full Wobble
entry.summary: Why Fedora 38 might Sway you to try it; and how it runs on the MacBook M1 Max.

entry.title: Linux Action News 289
entry.summary: What we like about Fedora 38, why the Rust foundation is in hot water, and more.

entry.title: 514: Designing a Villain
entry.summary: Elon launches another AI company, leaks suggest Apple might enable sideloading, and why we should let Chaos-GPT run free.

entry.title: 506: Three Wild and Crazy Topics
entry.summary: We surprise each other with three secret topics, with one big catch.

entry.title: Linux Action News 288
entry.summary: A classic gadget gets a Linux-powered new lease on life, the next project getting Rusty, great news for Btrfs users, and more.

entry.title: 513: Apple's Golden Hour
entry.summary: Forces beyond Apple's control just reined in their rise, and we ponder the coming sunset. Plus, the tool we found uses ChatGPT to help you debug errors.
